label: cor-pipeline-continuity-margin-stability
name: Pipeline Continuity Under Margin-Based Status Stability
natural_language_statement: Assuming the Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability, the deterministic component of the fitness potential operator's continuity bound converges to zero as the input swarms and velocity vectors converge.
description: This corollary shows that the Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability is a sufficient condition to ensure the continuity of the fitness potential operator. It does so by guaranteeing that for sufficiently small perturbations of the swarm, there are no status changes (e.g., a walker becoming a companion or vice-versa), which eliminates the primary source of discontinuity.
assumptions_hypotheses: The Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability (def-axiom-margin-stability) holds.
conclusion_main_result: The deterministic bound $F_{\text{pot,det}}$ from the Deterministic Continuity theorem converges to 0 as the input displacements go to 0. For small enough displacements ($d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2)^2 \le r_{\mathrm{status}}$), the number of status changes $n_c=0$, and the unstable term in the continuity bound vanishes exactly.

relations.description: The deterministic continuity bound vanishes as inputs converge.
If the squared displacement is within the status stability radius, the number of status changes is zero, eliminating the discontinuity.
